name: Best Actor in a Leading Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role

name: Best Actor in a Supporting Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role

name: Best Actress in a Leading Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actress in a Leading Role

candidates.notes: Glenda Jackson was not present at the awards ceremony. The film's writer-director-producer Melvin Frank accepted the award on her behalf.

name: Best Actress in a Supporting Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role

candidates.notes: Tatum O'Neal, at age 10, became the youngest winner ever in a competitive category. (Shirley Temple had won an Honorary Award at age 6 in 1935.)

name: Best Music, Original Song
normalized_name: Best Achievement in Music Written for Motion Pictures (Original Song)

candidates.notes: For the song "The Way We Were".
For the song "All That Love Went to Waste".
For the song "Nice to Be Around".
For the song "Live and Let Die".

name: Best Music, Scoring Original Song Score and/or Adaptation
normalized_name: Best Achievement in Music Written for Motion Pictures (Original Song)

candidates.notes: Julia Phillips became the first female producer to win the Best Picture category.

name: Best Short Subject, Live Action Films
